skill.name: Flow Nexus Cloud Swarm Deployment SOP
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing workflow procedures and configuration templates. No executable code with security implications was found. The skill operates through MCP tool calls and documented bash scripts for monitoring purposes only.

content.user_title: Deploy cloud agent swarms with Flow Nexus
content.value_statement: Managing distributed AI agents across cloud infrastructure is complex and error-prone. This skill provides a standardized 5-phase process to initialize, deploy, coordinate, monitor, and scale agent swarms using the Flow Nexus platform with automatic optimization.
actual_capabilities: Initialize cloud swarms with hierarchical, mesh, ring, or star topologies
Deploy 8+ specialized agents (coordinators, supervisors, workers) to E2B sandboxes
Create event-driven workflows with agent task assignments and triggers
Monitor performance metrics and generate optimization reports
Implement auto-scaling policies based on utilization thresholds
Coordinate multi-agent workflows through the Flow Nexus platform
limitations: Requires Flow Nexus MCP server and authenticated account
Does not create cloud infrastructure (relies on existing E2B setup)
No built-in error recovery for failed agent spawns
Manual intervention required for custom topology configurations

use_cases.title: Scale AI Development
use_cases.description: Deploy coordinated agent teams to handle large-scale development workflows across cloud infrastructure.

use_cases.title: Distributed Model Training
use_cases.description: Orchestrate multiple agents for distributed machine learning pipelines with event-driven coordination.

use_cases.title: Multi-Agent Research
use_cases.description: Coordinate research tasks across specialized agents with automatic scaling and performance optimization.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy a hierarchical cloud swarm with 8 agents for software development. Initialize the swarm, deploy coordinator, supervisors, and workers, then create a basic workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Topology
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy a mesh topology cloud swarm with Flow Nexus. Configure 10 agents for parallel task execution with event-driven triggers.

prompt_templates.title: Auto-Scaling
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a production-ready cloud swarm with auto-scaling policies. Configure monitoring, performance thresholds, and automatic agent scaling based on load.

prompt_templates.title: Full Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the complete Flow Nexus cloud swarm deployment: initialize swarm, deploy agents, create development workflow, monitor performance, implement auto-scaling, and generate deployment summary.

output_examples.input: Deploy a hierarchical cloud swarm with 8 agents for software development
output: ✓ 5 worker agents deployed (coders, tester, reviewer, docs)
✓ Full-Stack Development Workflow created and executing

best_practices: Start with hierarchical topology for complex workflows as it provides clear delegation paths
Monitor agent utilization continuously and adjust scaling thresholds based on actual workload patterns
Define agent specializations clearly to optimize task distribution and reduce coordination overhead
anti_patterns: Deploying too many agents initially without monitoring actual utilization and costs
Ignoring performance bottlenecks until they cause workflow failures
Setting auto-scaling thresholds too aggressive causing oscillation between scaling up and down

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex through their MCP integration capabilities.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of agents supported?
faq.answer:: Default is 10 agents, but can scale up to 15 with auto-scaling policies configured.

faq.question: How does it integrate with E2B sandboxes?
faq.answer: The skill uses Flow Nexus MCP calls to spawn agents in E2B cloud sandboxes for isolated execution.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external services?
faq.answer: Agent communications go through Flow Nexus platform. No sensitive credentials are transmitted.

faq.question: What if agent deployment fails?
faq.answer: Check Flow Nexus authentication, verify E2B sandbox availability, and review agent specifications for errors.

faq.question: How is this different from manual agent deployment?
faq.answer: This skill provides automated coordination, monitoring, auto-scaling, and optimization that would require significant manual effort.
